content: like to lock in my tie so that it doesn t accidentally get pulled out page 18 of 20 a happy hooker and her yarn tiny pom-pom cut a long length of yarn that you will use to tie around your pom-pom and use to attach to your hat now wind your yarn around a fork approximately 35 times then cut use the length of yarn you cut in the beginning and tie around the yarn on the fork gently pull your bunch of yarn from the fork and tie as tightly as you are able to cut the loops on both sides of your pom-pom then trim up the edges leaving the long lengths to secure to your hat page 19 of 20 a happy hooker and her yarn duck floaty 4 0mm hook beak all stitches worked into magic_ring single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet pull so that you have a ½ circle head worked in continuous rounds mc 6 r2 2sc around 12 r3 single_crochet increase around 18 r4-6 single_crochet around 18 at this point i recommend attaching the face first attach the beak between row 5 and 6 sew eyes onto face on either side of beak gently stuff and continue crocheting the rest of the head stuffing as you go r7 single_crochet decrease 12 r8 decrease 6 finish off leaving a long tail that you will use to sew onto the main part of the floaty floaty base 4 0mm hook worked in continuous rounds r1 mc 6 6 leave a long tail that you will use to tie floaty onto cactus r2 increase around 12 r3-45 single_crochet around 12 r46 decrease around 6 finish off leaving a long tail to tie floaty onto cactus page 20 of 20 a happy hooker and her yarn
